activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen S Tolefree

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report

8:51 AM Defendant Stephen S Tolefree not in court.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore in court for Stephen S Tolefree.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant does not appear. 
Defense indicates she has been trying to reach the defendant but has not been able to make contact with him. 
BTC: Bench warrant stayed until next court date. Atty Moore to email clerk for a hearing date.

4:26 PM Defendant Stephen S Tolefree not in court.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore not in court.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a bail bond hearing. 
Matter should have been canceled on 7/25/22 at the return on warrant hearing. 
BTC: Matter set over as previously scheduled.
Messaged JP at 11:26 AM to cancel warrant.
Warrant forwarded to JP for entry.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim M.H. (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stephen S Tolefree appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Stephen S Tolefree. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant,
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant returned back to court. Missing FTA date.
Warrant forwarded to JP for entry.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. Missed court 7/19/2022. $250 signature bond requested/ordered forfeited.

10:29 AM Defendant Stephen S Tolefree not in court.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erika Lynn Moore in court for Stephen S Tolefree. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter was scheduled as a plea and sentencing.  
Defendant does not appear. 
Defense has no explanation for defendant's not appearance and does not have a current phone number to reach defendant. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.

Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:14 AM   Defendant Stephen S Tolefree in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State indicates that the victim has not been notified of hearing and needs to set the pleas over; but does not have any objection to a signature bond for 22CM226 and 22CM392 no contact with victims and absolute sobriety with rcap monitoring.  

BTC; Granted 22CM226 $100 sig bond nocon and rcap; 22CM392 $250 sig bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
